description: This course examines the basic principles and methods of psychological science from an
evolutionary and cultural perspective. Students use critical thinking skills to examine
fascinating topics: dreaming, cultural influences, identity, learning, thinking and the
biology of behavior. Applying basic research methods, students act as skeptical scientists.
This course applies to almost any career choice in today's world and provides insight into
self and others. GE: NST, HBS. Offered every semester.
